Question
========

Randomly select an employee in a firm. We define the event *A* as the set of all female workers and *B* of the workers with a managerial position. It holds that *P* (*A*) = 0.46 and *P* (*B*|*A*) = 0.32. If you choose a random worker in this company, what is the probability that you choose a woman who is also in a managerial position?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,15
* 0,32
* 0,46
* 0,78

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.15: Correct
* 0.32: Incorrect
* 0.46: Incorrect
* 0.78: Incorrect
